intro: Melodinus inaequilatus, commonly known as the unequal-flowered melodinus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
